core

Class ComponentClassLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.ClassLoader
      • core.ComponentClassLoader

  • public class ComponentClassLoader
extends java.lang.ClassLoader
    FREVO Component Class loader that is used to load components being outside of the normal classpath using their binary names.

    Binary names

    Any class name provided as a String parameter to methods in ClassLoader must be a binary name as defined by the Java Language Specification.

    Author:
    Istvan Fehervari

      • ComponentClassLoader

        ComponentClassLoader(java.lang.String rootdir)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a new ComponentClassLoader that is used to load FREVO components outside of the classpath.
        Parameters:
        rootdir - The root directory where the classes are situated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given rootdir is null.

    • Method Detail

      • loadClass

        protected java.lang.Class<?> loadClass(java.lang.String name,
                                       boolean resolve)
                                throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Loads the class with the specified binary name. This method searches for classes in the same manner as the ClassLoader.loadClass(String) method. It is invoked by the Java virtual machine to resolve class references.
        Overrides:
        loadClass in class java.lang.ClassLoader
        Parameters:
        name - The binary name of the class.
        resolve - If true then resolve the class
        Returns:
        The resulting Class object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the class was not found

      • loadClassData

        private byte[] loadClassData(java.lang.String filename)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the byte data from the given class file.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the source data of the give class.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if I/O error occurs.
